headings.text: Transforming Lives, One Smile At A Time.™

paragraphs.text: Where we specialize in Orthodontics Excellence that creates beautiful smiles that last a lifetime. We are conveniently located in Denville, NJ and Riverdale, New Jersey and serve patients from all over New Jersey State making them feel special, beautiful and confident for a lifetime.
Our offices are equipped with state-of-the-art technology including Digital Panoramic Imaging, Invisalign® Clear Aligners and such to ensure our patients receive excellent results.

Our team of skilled and trained professionals is dedicated to providing each patient with the compassionate and individualised care they expect and deserve. Schedule your appointment with Fox & Abraham Orthodontics today!

Drs. Sonia Abraham & Bruce Fox are proud to offer outstanding Orthodontic care for patients of all ages, including children and adults. We ensure a pleasant and personalized experience by offering a wide range of braces to meet the needs and desires of each individual patient, incorporating the latest advances in Orthodontics including Invisalign® & the latest clear ceramic braces.

Orthodontists are dentists who have completed an additional 2 to 3 years of full-time, specialized University education in Orthodontics. Specialist Orthodontists have the knowledge and training to advise you on the full range of orthodontic options, including the best age to begin treatment. Orthodontists are doctors that specialize in straightening teeth, making them bite together properly, improving facial geometry and creating a great smile.

At Fox & Abraham, we are highly trained and experienced Specialists that go beyond the goal of transforming your smile in a positive way by adopting a holistic approach to Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopaedics that has the potential to transform you over a lifetime.

1. Is it required that my family dentist schedule my appointment with the orthodontist?No, it is not. Many of our patients are referred by their family dentist, yet many other patients take the initiative to schedule an examination themselves.

2. At what age should I schedule an appointment for an orthodontic screening?The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an orthodontic screening at age 7. By this age, several permanent teeth in most children have erupted, allowing us to effectively evaluate your orthodontic condition.

3. Will my teeth straighten out as they grow?No, they will not. The space available for the front teeth does not increase as you grow. In most people, after the permanent molars erupt, the space available for the front teeth decreases with age.
Put your best face forward.Invest in a Smile from a Specialist!

content.content: Orthodontists are dentists who have completed an additional 2 to 3 years of full-time, specialized University education in Orthodontics. Specialist Orthodontists have the knowledge and training to advise you on the full range of orthodontic options, including the best age to begin treatment. Orthodontists are doctors that specialize in straightening teeth, making them bite together properly, improving facial geometry and creating a great smile. At Fox & Abraham, we are highly trained and experienced Specialists that go beyond the goal of transforming your smile in a positive way by adopting a holistic approach to Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopaedics that has the potential to transform you over a lifetime.

content.title: Frequently asked questions
content.content: 1. Is it required that my family dentist schedule my appointment with the orthodontist?No, it is not. Many of our patients are referred by their family dentist, yet many other patients take the initiative to schedule an examination themselves. 2. At what age should I schedule an appointment for an orthodontic screening?The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an orthodontic screening at age 7. By this age, several permanent teeth in most children have erupted, allowing us to effectively evaluate your orthodontic condition. 3. Will my teeth straighten out as they grow?No, they will not. The space available for the front teeth does not increase as you grow. In most people, after the permanent molars erupt, the space available for the front teeth decreases with age.
